title: Nepal Airlines 2009 Airbus MoU Corruption Case
description:
This case concerns a corruption charge filed by the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) against Sugat Ratna Kansakar, then Executive Chairman of Nepal Airlines Corporation (NAC), and other officials. The charges stemmed from a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed with Airbus on November 5, 2009, to procure one A320 and one A330 aircraft.

The primary allegation was that on November 6, 2009, Kansakar authorized the transfer of a non-refundable commitment fee of $750,000 (approx. 57.3 million NPR) to Airbus without the approval of the NAC board and without securing the necessary financial resources for the full purchase. The CIAA accused the officials of violating the Public Procurement Act and embezzling the funds sent as the commitment fee.

The case proceeded through the legal system:

  • On December 25, 2010, the CIAA filed a formal case at the Special Court.
  • In February 2011, Kansakar was jailed after failing to post a demanded bail of Rs 60 million.
  • Airbus returned the $750,000 commitment fee to NAC in April 2011.
  • The Special Court acquitted all accused officials in 2012, with one of the grounds being that the state incurred no loss since the fee was returned.
  • The Supreme Court upheld this acquittal on April 25, 2013, bringing the case to a legal close.

It is important to note that a separate global settlement by Airbus in 2020 revealed admissions of bribery related to later aircraft sales to Nepal, providing context to the company's dealings in the country but was not part of this specific 2009 case.
unverified_info:
Conflation with the Wide-Body Scandal: Early reports and discussions about corruption at NAC often conflate this 2009 case with a separate, later scandal involving the purchase of two wide-body A330 aircraft. The alleged loss of Rs 4.35 billion is associated with the wide-body deal, not this case, which only involved the temporary transfer of a $750,000 commitment fee.

Discrepancy in Acquittal Date: There are minor discrepancies in media reports regarding the exact date of the Special Court's acquittal. While the Supreme Court decision confirms it happened, some sources cite April 2011, while others cite 2012. The 2012 date is used in the timeline as it aligns more logically with the 2013 Supreme Court appeal.
key_allegations: Embezzlement of a $750,000 commitment fee (equivalent to Rs 57.3 million).
Violation of the Public Procurement Act.
Making a financial commitment without board approval.
Authorizing payment without securing financial resources for the full aircraft purchase.
related_entities: Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA)

locations.other: Case filed and tried in Kathmandu
MoU signed at the Dubai Air Show

timeline.title: MoU Signed with Airbus
timeline.description: At the Dubai Air Show, NAC Executive Chairman Sugat Ratna Kansakar signs a Memorandum of Understanding with Airbus to purchase one A320 and one A330 aircraft.

timeline.title: Commitment Fee Sent
timeline.description: Nepal Airlines Corporation sends a non-refundable commitment fee of $750,000 to Airbus.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The CIAA files a corruption case at the Special Court against Sugat Ratna Kansakar and five other NAC officials for embezzling Rs 57.3 million.

timeline.title: Kansakar Jailed Over Bail Failure
timeline.description: The Special Court orders Sugat Ratna Kansakar to be sent to prison after he fails to post the demanded bail of Rs 60 million.

timeline.title: Airbus Returns Commitment Fee
timeline.description: Airbus returns the $750,000 commitment fee to Nepal Airlines. The exact date in April is not specified in sources.

timeline.title: Special Court Acquits Accused
timeline.description: The Special Court acquits Kansakar and all other officials of corruption charges, partly on the grounds that the fee was returned, preventing a loss to the state. The exact date is disputed.

timeline.title: Supreme Court Upholds Acquittal
timeline.description: The Supreme Court of Nepal upholds the Special Court's decision, finalizing the acquittal of Sugat Ratna Kansakar and the other officials in this case.
